content.raw:
Gotcha... `gzserver` starts a new Gazebo master and won't run if there's a server already running, so the script you proposed would have to start and stop Gazebo whenever you wanted to change the profile. This leads to different implementations of the example script that runs through different profiles, one where gzserver runs continuously and one where it gets started and shut down for each profile...

In pseduo-bash scripting that actually looks like python...

```
for all profiles:
  gzserver --pause
  gz physics -profile profile
  gz world --pause
  (wait to run experiment)
  gz world --reset
```

```
for profile in profiles:
  gzserver --profile profile
  (wait for experiment)
  (kill gzserver)
```
